trustfund:
TF092324-GEF FSP - INDONESIA: GEOTHERMAL
            POWER GENERATION DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Geothermal Power Generation Development Project is to
            promote the expansion of economic and environmentally
            friendly geothermal power generation in Indonesia, and to
            reduce CO2 emission from the power system. The project will
            assist the Government of Indonesia (GoI) to prepare and
            implement its geothermal sector reform program designed to
            remove the key policy and institutional barriers which
            presently prevent greater development of geothermal
            resources, and will assist in the transaction of geothermal
            power investments. The extension is necessary to compensate
            for initial delays in project implementation, and allow time
            for the completion of high priority activities under the
            following components: (i) component one: policy framework
            for scaling up the development of geothermal power; and (ii)
            component two: transaction management for mobilizing
            investments in geothermal power generation. The recipient
            has put in place a realistic action plan to ensure
            completion of the project by the revised closing date. The
            World Bank task team has reviewed the proposed action plan
            and has found it to be satisfactory. The action plan and
            implementation timeline are available in project files. This
            will be the first extension of the project.
